title: Michael J. Fox steps out in style with wife Tracy Pollan at the premiere of HBO's Very Ralph
text:
Michael J. Fox was all smiles in style alongside wife Tracy Pollan at the premiere of the new HBO documentary Very Ralph.

The 58 year old actor cut a stylish figure while stepping out with his 59 year old wife at the premiere, held at The Metropolitan Museum of Art on Wednesday evening.

The documentary Very Ralph, which follows the iconic career of fashion designer Ralph Lauren, debuts on HBO November 12.

Michael and Tracy: Michael J. Fox was all smiles in style alongside wife Tracy Pollan at the premiere of the new HBO documentary Very Ralph

Fox was wearing a grey dress shirt with no tie under a black suit coat with black pants and shoes for the premiere.

His wife Tracy Pollan, who he's been married to since 1988, was wearing a black dress with a gold chain and pendant around her neck.

She was also wearing a gold watch while carrying a small black handbag and black pumps for the event.

Stylish couple: Fox was wearing a grey dress shirt with no tie under a black suit coat with black pants and shoes for the premiere

Fox and Pollan first met on the set of Family Ties, when Pollan played Ellen Reed, the girlfriend of Fox's Alex P. Keaton.

They also worked on the 1987 film Bright Lights, Big City and started a relationship shortly thereafter, getting married in July 1988.

The happy couple have four kids together, 30 year old Sam, 24 year old twins Aquinnah and Schuyler, and 17 year old Esme.

First meeting: Fox and Pollan first met on the set of Family Ties, when Pollan played Ellen Reed, the girlfriend of Fox's Alex P. Keaton

Fox started showing signs of early-onset Parkinson's Disease in 1991, and he was fully diagnosed in 1992, but he didn't go public with his diagnosis until 1998, after he quit drinking.

He has since become a strong advocate for Parkinson's Disease research, creating The Michael J. Fox Foundation in 2000, dedicated to finding a cure for the disease.

Pollan has also authored The Pollan Family Table cookbook in 2014 with her mother and two sisters.

Parkinson's Disease: Fox started showing signs of early-onset Parkinson's Disease in 1991, and he was fully diagnosed in 1992, but he didn't go public with his diagnosis until 1998

Fox has still continued to work regularly, most recently starring as Louis Canning in CBS' The Good Wife.

He has also played himself on Curb Your Enthusiasm and voiced the title character in A.R.C.H.I.E. and A.R.C.H.I.E. 2.

He most recently starred in the Netflix movie See You Yesterday, which debuted in May.
